channel.title: ICERM Generative Models Discussion Group
channel.description: Recent content on ICERM Generative Models Discussion Group

item.title: Papers
item.description: Papers Here is a list of suggested papers, loosely organized by topic. Compositional Generative Models Lake, Brenden M., Ruslan Salakhutdinov, and Joshua B. Tenenbaum. 2015. “Human-Level Concept Learning through Probabilistic Program Induction.” Science 350 (6266): 1332–38. link George, D., W. Lehrach, K. Kansky, M. Lázaro-Gredilla, C. Laan, B. Marthi, X. Lou, et al. 2017. “A Generative Vision Model That Trains with High Data Efficiency and Breaks Text-Based CAPTCHAs.

item.title: Schedule
item.description: Schedule Tutorial on Probabilistic Programming When: Thursday 2019-02-28 10 am to 11 am Where: ICERM 10th Floor Classroom Presenter: Daniel Ritchie Scribe: Theresa Barton Overview of Deep Generative Models When: Tuesday 2019-03-05 10 am to 11 am Where: ICERM 10th Floor Classroom Presenter: Guangyao Zhou and Shubhendu Trivedi Scribe: Guangyao Zhou

item.title: About
item.description: The ICERM Generative Models Discussion Group is part of the Semester Program in Computer Vision at ICERM. We meet in most weeks in the Spring 2019 semester in the 10th floor classroom at ICERM. The discussion group will focus on the general research area of probabilistic generative models. For questions, please contact Guangyao Zhou.

item.title: Tutorial on Probabilistic Programming
item.description: On Thursday 2019-02-28 from 10 am to 11 am, Prof. Daniel Ritchie would give a tutorial on probabilistic programming in the 10th floor classroom at ICERM.
